function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Development and sharing of data models for infectious diseases","Impact":"Inadequate data models can lead to ineffective analysis and decision-making during an outbreak","Mitigation":"Adopting standardized data models and ontology-guided machine learning algorithms","Technologies":"Phenopackets, OHDSI standards, ontology engineering best-practices","People":"Epidemiologists, public health officials, researchers","Owner":"Developers, data scientists, ontology engineers"},{"Description":"Lack of machine-readable epidemiological quantitative data","Impact":"Hindrance in rapid analysis and evidence-based decision making during an outbreak","Mitigation":"Contributing to the development of ontological representation for data","Technologies":"Jupyter notebooks, GitHub repositories, data repositories","People":"Community, epidemiologists, public health officials","Owner":"Developers, data scientists"},{"Description":"Inadequate sharing of epidemiological quantitative data","Impact":"Impediment to collaborative research and decision-making during an outbreak","Mitigation":"Facilitating easier sharing of machine-readable epidemiological quantitative data","Technologies":"GitHub repositories, data repositories","People":"Research community, epidemiologists, public health officials","Owner":"Developers, data repositories"}]}
